ai-tha-ap446:1.1_0: “A Buddha praised the appearance of a golden palanquin,
ai-tha-ap446:1.4_0: Like a freshly blossoming sal tree
ai-tha-ap446:2.4_0: I wish to give alms food.’
ai-tha-ap446:4.1_0: Having descended into the sky, the Sambuddha,
ai-tha-ap446:4.2_0: he sat down on a leaf-hut,
ai-tha-ap446:4.3_0: Absorbed, a seized by my family,
ai-tha-ap446:5.1_0: when my mind is out of desire,
ai-tha-ap446:5.3_0: filling my mind with confidence in him,
ai-tha-ap446:5.4_0: I was paying respect to the Victor,
ai-tha-ap446:6.2_0: I used to be a fruit.
ai-tha-ap446:6.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap446:8.1_0: It was so welcome for me
ai-tha-ap446:10.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Bhallika.
ai-tha-ap446:11.1_0: for the fourth Elder Bhallika, having gathered round, for the fourth,
